channel.title: Character saved, but no Character file?!

item.title: Character saved, but no Character file?!
item.dc:creator: @Baylo Baylo
item.description:
@Baylo wrote:

Thanks - I’ve fixed my problem lol. I couldn’t see the txt files in the characters folder, but it turned out that was because I didn’t refresh eclipse and so they didn’t show up…

xD

item.source: Character saved, but no Character file?!

item.title: Character saved, but no Character file?!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Your character file should save in the “characters” folder, which is in the Data folder.
If you have it set up like a typical PI. The data folder is in the same folder as the src and bin folders.

Read full topic
item.source: Character saved, but no Character file?!

item.title: Character saved, but no Character file?!
item.dc:creator: @Baylo Baylo
item.description:
@Baylo wrote:

Hi there,

I’ve recently started working on a PI based source and client, and have been struggling to get it to load in eclipse and actually run - however, I’ve finally worked it all out!

…The only problem now is that when I log in, although the location of my player is saved, I can’t find where! There is a Character.txt file in the server folder, but it doesn’t update with new player’s txt files! I’d like to change the player rights and skills of the player but I can’t find his file!

This is what I found in the player save.java which seems to correspond to what I want:

try {
characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./Data/characters/"+playerName+".txt"));
File1 = true;
} catch(final FileNotFoundException fileex1) {
}
if (File1) {
new File ("./characters/"+playerName+".txt");
} else {
Misc.println(playerName+": character file not found.");
p.newPlayer = false;
return 0;
}

But it doesn’t seem to actually do its job…?

I’m not sure whether I have to link anything here or not, so I wont for the moment, but if any additional information is needed let me know!

Read full topic
item.source: Character saved, but no Character file?!
